Package ohos.aafwk.ability

Interface PipeFileWriter<T>


  • public interface PipeFileWriter<T>
    Provides methods that can be called by background threads to write data into a pipe.

    You must implement this interface first if you want to call Ability#createPipeFile(Uri, String, PacMap, T, PipeFileWriter) to transmit pipe data.

    Since:
    4
    See Also:
    ohos.aafwk.ability.Ability#createPipeFile(Uri, String, PacMap, T, PipeFileWriter)
    SystemCapability
    SystemCapability.Aafwk#ABILITY

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void write​(FileDescriptor output, Uri uri, String mimeType, PacMap pacMap, T args)
      Called by a background thread to write data into a pipe identified by the specified FileDescriptor.

    • Method Detail

      • write

        void write​(FileDescriptor output,
           Uri uri,
           String mimeType,
           PacMap pacMap,
           T args)
        Called by a background thread to write data into a pipe identified by the specified FileDescriptor.

        Note: The calling background thread may be blocked if data reading on the client is slow.

        Parameters:
        output - Indicates the FileDescriptor object into which the data is to be written. The system will close this object after it returns from this method.
        uri - Indicates the source Uri object whose data will be written.
        mimeType - Indicates the MIME type of the data to write.
        pacMap - Indicates the PacMap object containing the additional parameters to be passed in this call. This parameter can be null.
        args - Indicates the custom parameters that specify the data shared to the client. The type of this parameter is the same as the generic type in PipeFileWriter<T>.
        Since:
        4
